hints.content: The median is the dot in the center of the distribution, and the interquartile range describes how spread out the dots are.

The median bug found in the front yard is much larger than the median bug found in the back yard.

The interquartile ranges are similar because the spread of the dots is approximately the same.
The medians are different, but the lengths of the interquartile ranges are similar.

question.content:
**Length (in$\text{ mm}$) of bugs found in the front yard**

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a5f9a489eff1e59058fdd58ae9f9d044b0d0bebc.png) 

**Length (in$\text{ mm}$) of bugs found in the back yard**

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/9aabf9d97d0abb52cd8c8ed7310453a034b69b42.png)

**Which of the following is the best description of the comparison between the two dot plots shown above?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: The medians and the lengths of the interquartile ranges are similar.
The medians are similar, but the lengths of the interquartile ranges are different.
The medians are different, but the lengths of the interquartile ranges are similar.
The medians and the lengths of the interquartile ranges are different.
